main.name: Ryan Kirsch
main.bio: Hi there! I'm Ryan! I've been coding for over 3 years now. As a junior Full Stack developer, I've worked on many personal projects, and recently completed a six-month bootcamp via Nucamp to gain my MERN Full Stack credentials. After 10 years in finance, I realized my passion for development and engineering, and understood I wanted to make this my career. I'm looking for a full-time position, and bring REAL VALUE through my work ethic, project management experience, and financial industry knowledge. Switching careers is not easy, but it's certainly made easier when you find something you love.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me about job opportunities!

education.degree: Full Stack (MERN) Web & Mobile Development - Graduate with Honors
education.description: Completed all coursework and multiple personal portfolio projects to earn Honors distinction.

work.title: Project Manager
work.description: Researched, coordinated & managed database migration from proprietary system to HubSpot CRM, Shopify webstore, coupled with proprietary business workflow component for seamless data sync. Promoted from Assistant Sales Manager, requiring ongoing execution of Assistant Sales Manager duties.

work.title: Assistant Sales Manager
work.description: Promoted from Sales Representative. Supervised, trained, and motivated Sales Representatives for success within the company and beyond. Achieved top sales figures since 2014, averaging over $350,000 gross profit per year while working 100% remote since 01/2015.

work.title: Sales Representative
work.description: Investigated & qualified potential leads, then converted an average of 1/3 to invested client. Proposed, structured, & delivered portfolios of tangible assets ranging from $2,000 to $5 million. Excelled at outbound sales & generated ~40% of YOY business from existing clients.

testimonials.text: Ryan stood out to me as a very sharp student from very early on in the course. He has shown multiple great engineering qualities. He is one of the few who always engage and participate during class discussion and always eager to learn. I highly recommend him for any junior Web Development position or junior Software Engineer position. I believe that he would be a great asset to any company.
